Package BoringGame

Class Game

java.lang.Object
BoringGame.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Observer
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
Class which represents the Game. This class is what will be called in the Driver class, and should hold all methods needed to load, spawn and play the game.

  • Field Summary

    protected Farmer farmer

    Constructors

    Constructor for the game.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void drawObjects()
    drawObjects method which is responsible for drawing all the objects, this includes sprites, rectangles and the backround.
    void movement()
    Calculates the movement of the character.
    void pause()
    Pauses the game for x milliseconds.
    void playGame()
    Method which contains the while loop and calls all the other methods responsible for running the game (i.e movement, drawObjects, etc...)
    void update​(java.util.Observable clock, java.lang.Object o)
    Update method called every x seconds of the clock instance.

    • fieldSizeInt

      protected int fieldSizeInt

      protected Farmer farmer

    • passportValue

    • farmFields

      protected Fields[][] farmFields

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      Constructor for the game. Loads the window, adds all needed objects such as sprites and rectangles and sets their initial positions.

  • Method Details

    • movement

      public void movement()
      Calculates the movement of the character. Ensures the farmer doesn't collide with the shop, and doesn't walk out of the window. Also includes the animations of the movement, with the farmer facing different directions as he moves.

    • drawObjects

      public void drawObjects()
      drawObjects method which is responsible for drawing all the objects, this includes sprites, rectangles and the backround.

    • playGame

      public void playGame()
      Method which contains the while loop and calls all the other methods responsible for running the game (i.e movement, drawObjects, etc...)

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pauses the game for x milliseconds.

    • update

      public void update​(java.util.Observable clock, java.lang.Object o)
      Update method called every x seconds of the clock instance. This changes the season, which speeds up or slows down the growth speed.
      Specified by:
      update in interface java.util.Observer
